members.resolution_context: The French Revolution of 1789, which overthrew the monarchy and established a republic based on the principles of liberty, equality, and fraternity, served as a model for revolutionary movements across Europe and beyond.

class_description: The calendar year 2010, recognized as the onset year of the Arab Spring with the protests in Tunisia.
evidence_excerpt: Calendar year when the Arab Spring began with protests in Tunisia.

members.entity_description: Calendar year when the Arab Spring began with protests in Tunisia.
members.resolution_context: The Arab Spring, which began in 2010 with protests in Tunisia and spread across the Middle East and North Africa, led to the overthrow of long-standing dictators and sparked hopes for democratic change in the region.

class_description: Abstract or metaphorical concepts describing the gradual advancement of society and politics over time.
evidence_excerpt: Metaphorical path representing gradual social and political advancement over time.

members.entity_description: Metaphorical path representing gradual social and political advancement over time.
members.resolution_context: While the road to progress is often long and difficult, the legacy of past protests and revolutions serves as a reminder of the enduring power of the human spirit to overcome oppression and create a better world.

class_description: Abstract ideal of a future social order characterized by greater justice, freedom, and collective well-being.

members.entity_description: Envisioned future state of society characterized by improved justice, freedom, and well-being.
members.resolution_context: the enduring power of the human spirit to overcome oppression and create a better world.

class_description: Interrelated social and normative concepts concerning equality, social justice, human rights, and the unfair conditions (inequality, injustice) that social and political movements seek to address.
evidence_excerpt: abstract social ideals of equal rights and a fair, just, and equitable society pursued through justice movements

members.entity_description: A social and political condition in which individuals have the same rights, status, and opportunities regardless of identity, often pursued as a central goal of justice movements.
members.resolution_context: Both mentions describe the same abstract social ideal of equal rights and opportunities, framed as a core goal of justice movements; the type difference (AbstractConcept vs Goal) reflects context rather than distinct entities.

members.entity_description: An abstract social ideal and goal of creating fair, just, and equitable social arrangements and societies, often pursued through protests, revolutions, and reform movements.
members.resolution_context: Both mentions describe the same underlying ideal of a fair and equitable society pursued through political struggle, differing only in phrasing rather than concept.

members.entity_description: Unequal distribution of rights, opportunities, or resources among different groups.
members.resolution_context: The movement has sparked a national conversation on race and inequality, leading to widespread protests and calls for reform.

members.entity_description: Fundamental rights and freedoms that people worldwide are encouraged to fight for.
members.resolution_context: The movement inspired people around the world to stand up against injustice and fight for equality and human rights.

members.entity_description: Unfair social and political conditions that people are inspired to oppose.
members.resolution_context: The movement inspired people around the world to stand up against injustice and fight for equality and human rights.

class_description: The 1917 political revolution in Russia that overthrew the Romanov dynasty and led to the creation of the world's first communist state.
evidence_excerpt: The Russian Revolution of 1917, led by the Bolsheviks under Vladimir Lenin, brought an end to the Romanov dynasty and established the world's first communist state.

members.entity_description: Revolution in Russia that ended the Romanov dynasty and created the first communist state.
members.resolution_context: The Russian Revolution of 1917, led by the Bolsheviks under Vladimir Lenin, brought an end to the Romanov dynasty and established the world's first communist state.

class_description: The political goal of securing independence and self-rule from colonial or imperial domination, as pursued by colonized peoples.
evidence_excerpt: inspired people around the world to fight for their freedom and independence from colonial rule

members.entity_description: Political separation and self-governance sought by colonized peoples from imperial powers.
members.resolution_context: The American Revolution of 1776 marked a turning point in the history of protests and revolutions, as it inspired people around the world to fight for their freedom and independence from colonial rule.

class_description: All sovereign states (e.g., China, Belarus, the United States) that serve as settings or actors in the described political events.
evidence_excerpt: Tiananmen Square massacre in China ... crackdown on pro-democracy protesters in Belarus

members.entity_description: Country in East Asia where the Tiananmen Square massacre occurred.
members.resolution_context: From the Tiananmen Square massacre in China to the crackdown on pro-democracy protesters in Belarus, governments have used force to suppress dissent and silence opposition.

members.entity_description: Eastern European country where authorities cracked down on pro-democracy protesters.
members.resolution_context: From the Tiananmen Square massacre in China to the crackdown on pro-democracy protesters in Belarus, governments have used force to suppress dissent and silence opposition.

members.entity_description: Country in which the civil rights movement described in the text took place.
members.resolution_context: The civil rights movement in the United States, led by figures such as Martin Luther King Jr. and Rosa Parks, challenged racial segregation and discrimination.

members.entity_description: A country in North America, officially known as the United States of America.
members.resolution_context: The Black Lives Matter movement, which emerged in response to police brutality and systemic racism in the United States, has galvanized millions of people around the world to demand racial justice and equality.
